body_html:
Hi, all, I searched everywhere but cannot find the difference between ft.layers.dense and tf.contrib.layers.fully_connected.

Could you please point me out their difference?

And if dense only applies to the last axis, how can we do a real full connections of elements from all dims like in Cafffe? In Caffe, input is [N, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10, then output is: [N,10]
body_text:
Hi, all, I searched everywhere but cannot find the difference between ft.layers.dense and tf.contrib.layers.fully_connected.
Could you please point me out their difference?
And if dense only applies to the last axis, how can we do a real full connections of elements from all dims like in Cafffe? In Caffe, input is [N, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10, then output is: [N,10]
body:
Hi, all, I searched everywhere but cannot find the difference between ft.layers.dense and tf.contrib.layers.fully_connected. 

Could you please point me out their difference?

And if dense only applies to the last axis, how can we do a real full connections of elements from all dims like in Cafffe? In Caffe, input is [N, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10, then output is: [N,10]
